titlestmt.titleproper: John F. Frick and Co. receipt book 1851-1858
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: John F. Frick and Co. receipt book
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: John Frick and Co. was a shipping firm which operated out of Lumberton, New Jersey.

scopecontent.p: This is a receipt book for John F. Frick and Co., covering shipments between 1851 and 1858. Entries from 1851 to 1855 are written on the receipt stubs, and list goods shipped, the date of the shipment, the name of the ship and captain carrying the goods, and the weight of the shipment. The remainder of the entries, from 1855 to 1858, are written on the receipts themselves, and list the same information. Most of the shipments are of iron pipes, elbows, branches. Shipments were made primarily to locations on the Eastern seaboard, mostly Brooklyn.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.
